question: Is it permissible to take loans from banks in Kingdom Saudia Arabia?
answer:
QUESTION
My question is on loans given by Banks in Muslim countries.


I am an Indian working in Saudi Arabia from 2 years. There are lot of Banks in Saudi Arabia who approach us for loans.
Option 1): They charge some amount as service charge at the beginning and we have to repay within agreed duration.
Option 2) other is buy /sell method.

Is it permissible to take loans from banks in KSA? Few of the banks are listed below, almost all banks say they following Islamic banking

 
1) http://www.sabb.com/1/2/sabb-en/personal/amanah/deposits
2) http://www.riyadbank.com/English/PersonalBanking/IslamicBanking.html

3) http://www.shb.com.sa/vEnglish/showpage.asp?objectID={FC2B8B2A-C186-4A91-B705-842208EC0DD5}
   
Please guide us in the light of Shariah.


ANSWER


Share:

In the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.

As-salāmu ‘alaykum wa-rahmatullāhi wa-barakātuh.

 

The links provided in the question were examined; however, there isn’t sufficient information available on the intricate details of the transaction. Hence, we are unable to issue a ruling before analyzing the contract of the financial products offered by these institutions.

 

And Allah Ta’āla Knows Best
